courses.subject: NSCI
courses.title: Science and Applications of Biomimicry

meetings.instructor: Dr. CHOY Siu Wah,   Dr. WONG Tsz Yan
Dr. CHOY Siu Wah,   Dr. WONG Tsz Yan
Dr. CHOY Siu Wah,   Dr. WONG Tsz Yan

courses.description: Nature is full of wonders, beauty and wisdom. For so long we have been trying to learn ‘about’ nature. In fact there are so much we can learn ‘from’ it as if nature is our mentor. Biomimicry is about learning from Nature and emulate their designs to innovate sustainable solutions. For example, the hooks found on burs has inspired the invention of Velcro®, a fabric hook and loop fastener.Biomimicry provides an excellent platform to engage students in collaborative problem-based and integrated learning to solve real-world problems. Students will learn to work together and develop their creative problem-solving skills through identifying meaningful questions, searching relevant and credible information, developing sustainable solutions, and evaluating and sharing their solutions. It provides a new perspective for students to view questions differently and appreciate and value the natural world that we all share and live in.

courses.subject: NSCI
courses.title: Career Path Planning
courses.description: This course is designed to guide students in articulating and exploring their career pathways by helping them identify the most suitable career options within science disciplines across various industries. It aims to assist students in planning their career paths during their undergraduate studies.Participants will learn how to search for a range of science jobs related to their discipline and prepare a list of categorized potential careers. They will develop a comprehensive career plan that encompasses both academic and career preparation. Students are expected to reflect on and explore their own interests, strengths, and weaknesses, and will learn to self-assess their academic and non-academic achievements. Additionally, they will be taught how to create portfolios, personal statements, and CVs that effectively highlight their strengths specifically in science fields. The course will also provide opportunities for students to practice interviews, helping them build confidence in these critical contexts.

courses.subject: NSCI
courses.title: Healthy Ageing
courses.description: As ageing becomes an increasingly pressing global challenge, it is essential for future scientists to address the complexities of this phenomenon. This course offers science students a unique opportunity to explore the intricate interplay of biological, genetic, and environmental factors that shape healthy ageing.By focusing on key areas such as regenerative biology, genetics, nutrition, and environmental influences, students will gain a thorough understanding of the mechanisms that underlie the ageing process and explore innovative interventions aimed at promoting longevity and cognitive health. Through a dynamic blend of lectures, discussions, and project work, students will study the latest findings in regenerative medicine, genetic predispositions related to ageing and assess how environmental conditions impact health outcomes for older adults. This course prepares students to contribute meaningfully to solutions for the challenges posed by an ageing population.

courses.subject: NSCI
courses.title: Workshop on Data Science
courses.description: This course provides an opportunity for students to apply their knowledge to solve real-world problem. Students will be required to complete an individual project, give a final project presentation and submit a written report, on which their assessment will be based. Advisory: For students from Data Sciences Concentration (B.Sc. in Natural Sciences) only.

courses.subject: NSCI
courses.title: Internship

meetings.instructor: Dr. CHAN Ka Long Donald,   Dr. CHOY Siu Wah,   Dr. WONG Tsz Yan

schedule.class_attributes: English only Capstone Course Experiential Learning Course Internship

meetings.instructor: Dr. CHAN Ka Long Donald,   Dr. CHOY Siu Wah,   Dr. WONG Tsz Yan

schedule.class_attributes: English only Capstone Course Experiential Learning Course Internship

courses.description: This course provides opportunities for students to put knowledge and skills they learned from their corresponding concentration area into practice via engaging in a real-life experience in the government, private companies or non-governmental organizations. Internship can be held either locally or overseas, but must be approved by the Programme. Students are worked under the joint supervision of an academic supervisor and his/her agency supervisor and submit a report that reflects on the experience in the internship by the end of the internship period.
courses.course_attributes: Capstone Course Experiential Learning Course Internship
